speaker: Eddie
content: It's all gone. Everything my ex-husband worked for all those years gone.
mark: It's all gone.全都没了；一切都消失了；全都不见了
all those years 那些年；这么多年；所有那些年

speaker: Huber
content: Don't worry about clothing. I already started a collection from people in the neighborhood.
mark: clothing n. 衣服 == clothes
collection n. 收藏品，收集物；募捐；一堆

speaker: Eddie
content: What? I don't want to wear other people's old crap.

speaker: Huber
content: Eddie, you can be homeless or you can be ungracious. You really can't afford to be both.
mark: ungracious adj. 穿着寒碜；无礼貌的，没规矩的；没有教养的；讨厌的
gracious adj. 有礼貌的，和蔼的；豪华舒适的，富足安逸的

speaker: Eddie
content: That reminds me. My insurance check still hasn't come yet. Could I stay with you a few more weeks?
mark: That reminds me.这倒提醒我了；那让我想起来了
insurance n. 保险；保险费；保险业；
check n. 支票(美式) == cheque(英式)
a few more weeks 再多几周

speaker: Huber
content: Of course. What kind of Christian would I be if I denied shelter to a friend in need?
mark: What kind of person would I be if ...如果…… 我会是怎样的一个人啊
What kind of... 是一个疑问词组，在句中作表语，用于询问种类。
Christian n. 基督徒，信徒
deny  v. 否认；拒绝承认；拒绝给予
shelter n. 居所，住处；遮蔽物，庇护处v. 提供庇护，提供保护；躲避，避难
deny shelter to sb 拒绝为某人提供住所；不给某人提供庇护 (反：offer shelter to sb)
sb in need 有需要的某人；处于困境中的某人

speaker: Huber
content: Oh, look. Here's something we can salvage. Your measuring cup. We can just scrape off the burnt part and it'll look good as new.
mark: salvage n. 抢救，救援；  v. 打捞，抢救；挽救
scrape off 刮掉  scrape v.（用小刀等）刮除；（使）刮擦；擦伤，刮坏
look good as new 看上去完好如新

speaker: Eddie
content: That's not my cup. Mine was plastic.

speaker: Huber
content: Well, how did it get in here?

speaker: Eddie
content: I don't know. Who cares? Now, could you put that down and start looking for jewelry?
